hours_text:
# Welcome to the Henry!

Photo: Jonathan Vanderweit.

The Henry is a museum for contemporary art and ideas, grounded in the belief that art has the power to challenge norms, inspire change, and create a more equitable world. As Washington State’s first art museum, the Henry is internationally recognized for groundbreaking exhibitions, dynamic programs, and a long-standing commitment to championing artists at every stage of their careers. With a collection of nearly 30,000 objects and a deep partnership with the University of Washington, the Henry serves as a welcoming cultural hub, amplifying a diverse range of artistic voices and offering transformative, first-hand experiences that spark curiosity and new perspectives. 

Art in your inbox! Subscribe to our [e-newsletter](https://henryart.us2.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=757c8042ce6b7e915ec261866&id=6d4eb683e9) to stay in the know about exhibitions, programs, and happenings.

##  Museum Hours 

**Museum Hours**  
Monday – Wednesday: Closed  
Thursday: 10 AM – 7 PM  
Friday – Sunday: 10 AM – 5 PM

The last entry to the museum is 30 minutes before closing. 

**City Grind Café Hours**  
Monday: Closed  
Tuesday – Friday: 9 AM – 4 PM  
Saturday - Sunday: 11 AM – 3 PM

The Henry is closed on:  
Juneteenth  
Independence Day  
Labor Day  
Veteran's Day  
Thanksgiving Day  
Christmas Day  
New Year's Day  

The Henry closes at 3 PM on:  
Christmas Eve  
New Year's Eve  

##  Admission 

**Admission to the Henry is free to all visitor...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

Photo: Jonathan Vanderweit.

The Henry is committed to providing a welcoming and accessible experience for all our visitors. Read more about accessibility options below. Our friendly Visitor Experience Representatives are available to assist you—inquire at the front desk or look for team members with a green lanyard inside the galleries. We are here to help! 

Questions or requests? Please call 206.221.3850 or e-mail [info@henryart.org](mailto:info@henryart.org). 

The UW Office of the ADA Coordinator is also available to assist you. Contact 206.543.6450 (voice), 206.543.6452 (TTY), or [dso@uw.edu](mailto:dso@uw.edu).

##  Onsite & Online 

#### Admission 

The museum is free to all visitors.

#### Wheelchair Access

The museum is accessible by wheelchair, including the auditorium and restrooms. All three levels of the museum can be accessed via an elevator. Wheelchairs are available free of charge at the front desk. Please inquire at the front desk upon arrival.  

#### Service Animals

Task-trained service animals are welcome to assist visitors in the museum. Pets are not allowed.

#### Seating & Folding Chairs

Seating is available in the café, the Sculpture Court, and throughout the museum. Lightweight, foldable chairs for in-gallery use are available upon request—please ask our staff for assistance.

#### Restrooms

The Henry has two all-gender restrooms on the Mezzanine Level. Gendered restrooms are located on the Upper Level. All restrooms are fully ac...
